page.title: 07Hop Farming in Felton Area
page.content: Hop flowers which grow on a vine approximately five metres high are used for the brewing of beer. Rosemaund Experimental Farm and six other farms grow hops in this area. The different varieties grown are Fuggles, Challenger, North Down and Zenith. The total area is 57.5 hectares. The hops are harvested by machine and at the farms are dried by oil-fired burners and bagged under pressure in 50 kg pockets. Drying time is approximately eight to ten hours. The hops are sold several years in advance to the breweries. The future of the hop as a crop is uncertain. The hop virus Verticillium wilt has claimed two farmers' hops in the past year and the disease is eradicated by grubbing up and not replanting for at least five years.
